greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = a(a(n-A002828(n))) + a(n-a(n-A002828(n))) with a(1) = a(2) = a(3) = 1, where A002828(n) = the least number of squares that add up to n.
comment: Does a(n)/n converge to some value near 0.6 ? See for example: a(10) = 6, a(100) = 62, a(1000) = 604, a(10000) = 6050, a(100000) = 60414.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 23 2017
